Reviews.Title: “Our One Night Stay at DoubleTree Suites”
Reviews.Author: JSLPCrew
Reviews.Content: We'd booked a one night stay at the Doubletree for our night arrival into Phoenix. After our evening flight from Toronto, we grabbed a cab from the airport. I selected this hotel due to its close proximity to the airport knowing we would be arriving into Phoenix at around 1:00am EST. The taxi was about $16.00 dollars to the hotel. It was late and we were tired and a bit little grouchy. Upon arrival at the hotel, the front desk pleasantly greeted us and asked how our flight was. We begrudgingly said so-so. The front desk responded by saying "Maybe an upgrade to one of our suites would help improve your night." This was unexpected and perked us up some. The front desk completed our check-in with fresh baked cookies (which were delicious) and we were off to our room. Hotel The hotel lobby, reception and dining/lounge facilities are inside whereas the rooms face inwards in an octagonal shaped open air lobby with a little palm garden terrace in the centre. There are about 5 or 6 floors as well as a pool. There is a lounge and restaurant and buffet breakfast was included in our stay. The buffet was really good with a broad selection of dishes. Room Description The suite came with a kitchenette, living room, and bedroom with a huge wall unit in the master bedroom and two tvs. Water and coffee are included. The bathroom was very nice as well and everything was extremely clean. The space was also very quiet which is important to me as I'm a light sleeper. Overall the hotel exceeded our expectations and was the perfect place to grab some comfortable shut-eye and breakfast in close proximity to the Phoenix airport before the start of our trip. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy!”
Reviews.Author: satisfaction2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed to 'overnight' to recover from our flight, having just spent 10 hours in a plane from the UK! Our initial room was too far for my husband to walk with crutches, but there was no problem at all changing to a more convenient one. What a pleasure to walk in to the sitting room, with comfortable chairs and large flatscreen TV, on into the bedroom with the most amazing mattress and pillows I've ever slept on, and where there was another large flatscreen TV! I wish we could have stayed longer! The staff were very helpful - the cookies very tasty - and bottled water offered a great touch. Our deal included breakfast which we enjoyed very much. Look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PVJennybean
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the DoubleTree on an overnight prior to flying into Mexico for Christmas. I did get an amazing advance purchase price, but that just made the room even better. Nice sized suite with comfortable furnishings, a small bar fridge and sink, flat screens in both living area and bedroom. Separate bedroom with one of the more comfortable hotel beds I've ever slept in. The warm cookie at check-in is a very nice touch (tasty too), but the staff here make the difference. Very warm, friendly, prompt and efficient. Shuttle to and from the airport was quick and timely. The hot breakfast bar was included in my room price, and was very good. My only con for this hotel, was that the bathroom was a bit dated and needed some work (loose tiles, some slight peeling of wallpaper in corners). It was scrupulously clean so I didn't consider it a deal breaker, but I did mention to the front desk that the tile work was getting loose and there were some touch ups needed. They immediately made note of the room so it could be blocked for work, I thought that was a nice proactive step. This is definitely on my list of airport hotels for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Bang on the Money”
Reviews.Author: Benja764
Reviews.Content: If you travel enough all hotels start to blend into one shapeless blob in your memory; that goes double for airport hotels, even more so for chains. This is why our one night stay at the Doubletree stands out. There are certain things that you expect at a Doubletree, the warm cookies at reception, a certain decor, that kind of thing. The interesting thing is that this one stands out. Reception was just that much friendlier, the rooms roomier, and the restaurant offered really good food. A hotel that exceeds expectations. What a concept. And yes, it's very conveniently located to both downtown Phoenix and Sky Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PaulLori
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to the airport, Light Rail and most Phoenix tourist spots. The staff was friendly and efficient and the breakfast buffet was above average with wide variety.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels in Phoenix downtown / airport”
Reviews.Author: FlagstaffAZ1
Reviews.Content: This is our favorite hotel if we have a flight to catch or activities downtown Phoenix. We love the divided room to make a homey feel a TV in each room, one the bedroom and the other living area with pull out couch bed. Their is a refrig and microwave. Free wireless internet (or wired too). Their pool is heated nice on those cool nights. open 7am - 11pm. With a hot tub too. Love being greeted with their famous chocolate chip cookies. And their breakfast, fruit, eggs, bacon, ham, juice, coffee. Is all included!! It is the best way to start off the day. Breakfast is 7am to 10am, so sometimes we miss it do to early flights out. They have a free shuttle to the airport that runs every half-hour. On our latest trip we went to the zoo which is about 8 blocks going East. The light rail is also right out front if you want to explore the city, go to a baseball game, etc... It is not a resort hotel like some others, but for the price, they are the BEST bargin out there. Always friendly staff as well. A place we always recommend fellow travelers. Good for family and business. Plus we always get a good nice rest -- love their beds.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: RedheadVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree on business and boy am I glad I chose this property. From the moment I arrived at 3am in the morning, the shuttle driver and front desk agent were both very welcoming and understood my long day ahead. The hostess with the mostess as they say was also very friendly each morning for breakfast. I even had to ask Mickey in Sales for some assistance as I needed a tablecloth for my presentation and she was gracious and accommodating. Thank you to the crew at the Doubletree in Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: threekiddos
Reviews.Content: It is a short drive from the airport. We stayed on the 3rd floor. The kiddos like the fruit trees in the courtyard and the yummy cookies upon arrrival at midnight. Beds were comfortable. Nice to have wet bar sink. Breakfast was very, very nice. I'd go back and recommend to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Room Cramped”
Reviews.Author: crnbrdfrts
Reviews.Content: The organization I work for held a 3 day conference at this facility. We notified the hotel that on a particular day we would have approximately 90 guests. The room they placed us in was fit for around 50. They placed chairs along the walls, next to the water station, etc. We received many upset reviews regarding this facility from our attendees. The next day, we only had around 25 attendees so the room worked out perfectly. Guest room was decent for a DoubleTree. They did put the guest room on the complete opposite side of the hotel, so it made for a long haul with the box of supplies each day to the event room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ALP1991
Reviews.Content: The design of the property is a bit funky, but overall it's just fine. The rooms come with a complimentary breakfast for two which was not great, but very good. The staff was extremely friendly and of course the cookies just can't be beat. If you plan on using the light rail system to get to Tempe or downtown Phoenix, this is a great place to stay. Just a one-block walk and you're at the 44th Street station. Plus, complimentary airport transportation, so you can do your entire Phoenix trip without a car, depending on your itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: AlexLA12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2012 for the Fiesta Bowl. The location was great -- 1 block north of the lightrail station, which allows for a quick bus ride to the airport and a 15 minute ride to downtown. We got a great rate especially considering the fact that this was during the holidays, and the staff was very friendly. I have had better breakfasts at other properties, but since it is free, it's hard to complain. Note that breakfast closes relatively early since I think the property caters to businessmen, so make sure you don't miss out. Unfortunately, the pool wasn't heated well (or at all) so the ocean-like temperature wasn't particularly enjoyable. Overall, we had a great stay and would consider returning to this hotel if back in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty grounds”
Reviews.Author: Teresa A
Reviews.Content: Very nice but not outstanding. I had requested two double beds, and they put us into a single King. They quickly corrected, but the 2nd room and its location was not as nice as the first. Pools were clean, grounds/flowers were very pretty, and the lemon trees were very fragrant! Bartender at the pool ignored us, and made us walk up for our orders even though we saw him walking around taking/delivering orders to others. Work out room was very well outfitted - weight machines, free weights, mats, balls, several treadmills/ellipticals/bikes, racquetball court. Room was dark and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Curly8
Reviews.Content: Used Honor Points to stay here after arriving at airport and prior to driving to Grand Canyon next day. Have a 10 year old, so it was nice that he had his own space in the all suite hotel and we each had our own TV! Of course the cookies were excellent as usual. Surprised at the high quality and selection at the free breakfast buffet. Best I have ever seen. Tons of fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, crepes, etc. Staff was very friendly. Also had a bar/restaurant where my husband was able to get a late night sandwhich and watch the NCAA games. Parking was no problem. Beds were comfortable and very soft ( I like them that way). Certainly served our purpose and I would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Large suite for a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this hotel visiting with friends in the Phoenix area. I was pleasantly surprised with my 1-bedroom suite. The bed was very comfortable and food/drinks in the restaurant were great. Enjoyed the free airport shuttle as well. Definitely a place to come back to!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, roomy, and at a good value”
Reviews.Author: Jack90291
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here many times over the years, and we've never been diosappointed. The rooms are clean and comfortable with much more room than we need. The two-room suites are great, with a flat screen TV in each room! And the A/C keeps things cool.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit outdated but ok”
Reviews.Author: BRLArgentina
Reviews.Content: Spent one night on February 2012 with my wife and 2 kids. The hotel needs a refresh but is good enough for spending a few days. The breakfast was good, and it is really close to Sky Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Came back for the cookies!”
Reviews.Author: wheretonext08
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 night stay followed by a one night stay the same week. Very great location, close to the light rail station. We used the rail system to get to the basketball game and a concert and it was wonderful. Room was very clean, and the breakfast was delicious,even though we only made it once! The cookies given out at the register were marvelous!,

Reviews.Title: “Turned out to be better than at first glance”
Reviews.Author: Phylgary_10
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay for 4 nights at this hotel. The location is good -- right off the 202 and fairly close to restaurants and shopping and about 10 minutes from Casino Arizona. There was plenty of complimentary self parking, check-in was smooth (we got the usual yummy chocolate chip cookies) and the exterior and grounds of the hotel were very nice. Our 2-room suite was on the second floor, not too far from the pool and fairly close to the outdoor elevator. When we first entered the suite, we were slightly disappointed as the liviing area looked a bit dated. Everything seemed to improve as we settled in. There were 2 flat screen TV's and a small refrigerator as well as a coffee maker. The bedroom was very comfortable -- as with all Hilton hotels, the bed was wonderful. There was a small vanity area in the bedroom. The view from our living area was of the innter courtyard and pool area. There's a good cafe/restaurant in the hotel as well as an internet cafe area and a bar with a large TV. All in all, we were comfortable -- but this was not a luxury suite.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Place to Stay at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Stu44mag
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were making a weekend trip to Phoenix to visit another couple. I could not pass up the rate, as it was not much more than the "non-resort" hotels in the area. We reserved a two room suite, with a king bed, living area, and two bathrooms. The front desk staff was very nice, as was the bellman who showed us to our suite. We had much more room than we needed, but that is better than the alternative. We walked the grounds, which are expansive, and we enjoyed the beautiful landscaping. There are multiple swimming pools, complete with hot tubs and a bar. The bed was comfortable, and we slept well! The only negative thing that I would point out was the sofa, which was completely worn out. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A superb oasis in the desert.”
Reviews.Author: projectorfixer
Reviews.Content: As someone who spends about 100 nights each year in a hotel it takes a bit to impress me. This property did. Every aspect of our stay at this property exceeded our expectations. The front desk staff was efficient and very welcoming. The room was clean, well appointed, well maintained and, most importantly, very comfortable. Given the desert climate the hotel was built with the rooms opening to a large open air atrium. Although the daytime temperature was about 70 and the evenings were a cool 47 the jacuzzi was comfortable for an evening dip. Our room rate included breakfast in the restaurant buffet. The selection of foods was good though fairly standard for hotels breakfasts. We had an evening dinner consisting of steak salads provided by room service. We ordered ten minutes before the evening cut-off and the food was delivered promptly and piping hot 10-15 minutes later. The salads were excellent. Overall I'd have to say that this was one of the finest properties that I've stayed at over the course of the last year. If I find myself passing through Phoenix in the future this property will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good Value”
Reviews.Author: 40LVE
Reviews.Content: I found this property through Trip Advisor at a good rate. For the money you would normally pay for a motel this exceeded my expectations. I had a spacious suite with two TV's. HBO Movies are included at no additional charge. Nicely furnished, the bed very comfortable. There is a restaurant and bar attached to the property, through an adjoining corridor. The restaurant food is of average quality, but I only had appetizers in the bar, but the atmosphere was of an upscale coffee shop. There is a decent size swimming pool that was not crowded in October. One disappoinment was the in-room coffee. The first cup I made was terrible; thinking it might be the Phoenix water I used my own bottled water and tried again--still terrible--must be the coffee maker. All in all, though, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Creampuff77
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Clean rooms, comfy beds, excellent staff. Close to restaurants and shopping. Had lots of fun and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year's Day at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: Stewiegirl
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice of place to stay after the flight from Philadelphia. It was so easy to call from the airport for our shuttle, which arrived within a few minutes. The hotel is set back from the street and is offsite from the airport, although quite close. Dinner in the restaurant was excellent and very quiet that evening. On January 2nd we asked about getting a rental car to get up to the condo we had rented, and the shuttle driver recommended an off-airport rental agency to which he drove us after his airport run. Physically, the facility was very satisfactory. Wanted to get into the pool, which looked great, but we had to move on. Staff were all very pleasant. It was a great start to the New Year!

Reviews.Title: “Oldie But Goodie”
Reviews.Author: PennaDutch53094
Reviews.Content: Although the property is a little dated, and we had quirky hot water, I bump it up to five big ones for the following reasons: First, the value. For the price we paid for four nights (under $450.00) and the freebies (shuttle, breakfast, cookies and superior customer service) this is an outstanding value. The hotel employees really have no control over facilities that may be a little dated, but they consistently seem to strive to make the best out of what they have. There are also the little "touches" like the alstromeria flowers throughtout the hotel, the carnation that came one night with our room service, and the fastest and most efficient maid service we ever encountered. For a free breakfast it was good....the catch phrase being "free" and as much as you want both eating in or taking it out. Also, if compared to five star locations (like the caribbean) this is six stars because of employee effort. We sleep on 15 inches of memory foam and water pillows so we do not expect to sleep all that well in a hotel. However, the king size bed mattress here at the doubletree was surprising good. We slept pretty good. We were in the back of the hotel in room 346 so the noise issue was minimum (one of the few times I did not have to use my ear plugs to sleep at a hotel). We also had dinner at the restaurant and it too was well above average....served promptly and hot with a pleasant server. So I would say 4.5 stars rounded up to 5. Sometimes I think that people checking in after their subsidized agony (a commercial airline flight) take that frustration out on the hotel, since there is no use complaining about airline flight....at any rate I would certainly recommend this establishment to any of my associates.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: utahartist
Reviews.Content: We could only stay one day in Phoenix and choose the Doubletree Suites. The room was excellent as was the price. It was only with great difficulty that we left this clean, well appointed suite to catch a flight to Vegas. This is a top-notch, top of the line Hotel! The best we have visited in years. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, comfy beds, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: davioAz
Reviews.Content: Lovely property, fountains running in the courtyard. Beds were perfect, pillow-tops, I slept perfectly. Heard very little from the people above us...I suspect high-quality construction/sound-insulation, as I observed the double-thick wall twixt our bedrm and bathroom--I could literally hear no bathroom activities from our bed adjacent to the bath. Full, hot buffet brkfst that was constantly being refreshed. Scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausage, bacon, plus cereals and pastries. The fresh-cut fruits were a treat. Staff were knowledgeable and polite. Airport shuttle runs 24 hrs a day--used it with perfect connections. Pool a bit cool @ 72 degrees, but hot tub was fine.

Reviews.Title: “cold jacuzzi, no one cared”
Reviews.Author: northcountry3
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a one night stay on Dec. 23. Have just come from the cold country, we were anticipating a good soak in the hot tub, only to find that it was colder than the pool! I told the front desk and was told in a condescending tone "you have to turn the knob on". When I said it was the temp, I was ignored. Late that night, I again phoned a different person at the front desk and was told "no one else has said anything". The next morning, I again told a different person who said "really? I'll have to contact the maintenance people". By 10 a.m. it still wasn't fixed. When I asked for an adjustment on our bill, I was told there was nothing they could do. I understand problems happen, but their whole attitude was "too bad, so sad, haha". Repair details in the room were poor. The door handle between rooms was loose. The ceiling panel access in the bathroom was chipped and unpainted. There was just a general air of lack of care and consideration for the guests. BUT, the free breakfast buffet was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for business travel”
Reviews.Author: boston_abby
Reviews.Content: Flew in for a one night stay for a business meeting. The hotel was really convenient to the airport, just a short taxi ride. The area is fine, but it's not far from a questionable neighborhood; so I liked the fact that the hotel was self contained. The rooms/suites are great and very comfortable. The restaurant was fabulous! And the service was very friendly. All in all, I'd definitely stay there again next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty with no Wifi!”
Reviews.Author: ag_rhodes28
Reviews.Content: For a "four and a half star" hotel I was sadly disappointed. The rooms were extremely dirty. Not dusted with spider webs above the door and a very dirty toilet! Also had a centipede in our entry way which was absolutely disgusting! But even past the dirt the worst part was NO WIFI! They do offer it in the lobby but the signal is awful! It's 2011 get your guest wifi in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Base”
Reviews.Author: London_Scooter71
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband while we did the usual treck through the state to see the Grand Canyon and other attractions. We weren't at the hotel very much in the day but we found it very comfortable, the room was lovely and clean. There is a swimming pool with hot tub which we enjoyed. Breakfast is a feast! We were here for nearly two weeks so ended up mostly eating the fruit on offer but there is full cooked breakfast on offer. The hotel is so close to the airport but you aren't disturbed by the airplains at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place”
Reviews.Author: frtundra
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay again. Very good service and food. Conference facilities also very good and everything went smoothly. Room was extremely comfortable with more than enough space.

Reviews.Title: “Quick but Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MDHKLR04
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights and would defiantly stay again, about 8 minutes from the Airport via a free shuttle. Nice size, clean rooms and the staff was fantastic. They were very helpful and attentive. The hotel was sold out on my first night so when I went to the very small hotel gym at 5:00 in the morning I had to wait for 20 minutes to use one of the two treadmills. Given the size of the hotel , I would have expected a larger gym with much more equipment. All in all it was a great stay and I will stay again when business brings me back to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Party central, but we had a quiet suite”
Reviews.Author: retiredJB
Reviews.Content: This would be an excellent conference hotel. Lots of outdoor spaces. Very nice public indoor spaces. Staff friendly. Some of the group we were traveling with said that they were kept awake by parties in other suites, but we were in room 148, which was quiet and away from the pool. The courtyard is beautifully landscaped with local plants and everything is labeled. They had a free shuttle from the airport, but you may have to wait awhile. Suite was spacious and comfortable. I would stay there again. We ordered room service, which was excellent, and watched the World Series. Relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. A little pricy but very good service”
Reviews.Author: ikazi
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great. Hotel quality is good. Sleep quality is very good. And if you are going to be working in the vicinity. Walkable to everything. Just that you will have to dine at the chinese center close by & breakfast at a local deli. But both are pretty good too.

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree - Like being home”
Reviews.Author: berryblue2010
Reviews.Content: Being in a Doubletree suite felt homey with 2 television sets, a dining/office table, refrigerator and microwave. Upon checking in, we were given 2 warm Doubletree chocolate cookies. Yummy! Great snacking. We ordered a couple more with pizza one night, and bought more to take home with us. Staff was so nice and helpful. Being in a warm locale, the room we stayed in was accessed by an open walkway, not a corridor/hallway, which surrounded the pool below. Hotel makes it easy for guests to print air boarding passes through use of its computer with printer. Shuttle service was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Going in the wrong direction?”
Reviews.Author: prhnjd
Reviews.Content: This was about my 10th stay at this hotel and I have a sense that it's on the cusp of going downhill. The rooms -- all large suites -- remain well appointed. There are two flat screen tvs, a fridge, microwave, bath with a shower/tub. The bed is very comfortable. Where things are moving in the wrong direction: bathroom amenities were not always replaced when finished breakfast food quality seems to have gone downhill along with some options. My views may also have been affected by the fact that fire alarms went off fourbtimes between 4and 6 in the morning due to a problem with the swimming pool and very bad weather.

Reviews.Title: “I think it was previously an Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: CheapEnglishman
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has stayed at an Embassy Suites will immediately recognize the room configuration. It's the classig configuration with a window at the front facing the walkway where you enter into the living room. The bedroom is then at the back with a window facing the parking lot. It is unusual for a Doubletree to be an exterior corridor but the weather in phoenix rarely rains so I was not surprised. The pool is in the center with the courtyard with the rooms full encircling it. This puts the pool into shadow by 4pm (In October) so I couldn't chill out in the after work. I ate in the restaurant both for dinner and breakfast. The dinner menu is a casual dining menu (burgers, sandwiches, steak). I ordered the Tomato Soup and Open Faced Beef and Gravy Sandwich. My only complaint is the sandwich arrive only two spoonfuls into the soup so it sat getting cold while I ate my appetizer. Breakfast was included in the price and was a buffet style with a full cooked option of bacon, eggs, potatoes as well as cereal, pastries and bread. I would go back, but I do find the living rooms dark because you have to leave the curtains closed as the window is on the walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic 'Pit Stop'”
Reviews.Author: Neil R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after spending about 14 hours travelling from the United Kingdom and decided that it was best to get a place to sleep prior to commencing our fly-drive holiday. What a great decision that turned out to be. The staff to a man/woman were friendly and helpful, the Reception staff helped ensure that our luggage that was briefly ‘lost’ by American Airlines was re-patriated with us overnight and let us know all we needed to about the hotel. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable and we both got a great night’s sleep on the bed. The bar was well stocked with a variety of beers and the food that we ate in the bar was very promptly served and great tasting. Additionally, though a wedding and reception was being held at the hotel during the evening we arrived, you could not hear this in the rooms and did not impact on our stay at all. We woke early as a result of jet lag and decided to have a swim in the pool, which was very refreshing, as was the comfort of the spa/Jacuzzi. My only small issue would be with the complimentary breakfast, as it wasn’t completely ‘free’ as a tip was required for the staff, however, I think this is just a cultural difference between the UK and the USA, I’d caveat my comment here by explaining that the Breakfast was a very wide ranging buffet and very tasty. A hotel I would definitely recommend to you to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue for conferences, stays in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: WVTraveler88
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd or 4th stay at this hotel for conferences of one sort or another. The staff was great, love the layout of the hotel, built around pools galore. Still a lovely hotel, big suites, clean, well-kept. Would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Aging but Okay”
Reviews.Author: mstephens7
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for business. The hotel complex is aging a bit and could use some updating but overall it was fine. Large layout means lots of walking and elevators to get to lobby and breakfast if you are placed in the back. Would suggest this one if location works well. Could not get a room at Biltmore for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: RandyRandy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the DoubleTree Suites for 1 week on business. Close to the airport (free shuttle), and close to our company's offices. Checkin was courteous, my accommodation was a 2 room king suite. Comfortable bed, clean bath, excellent wi-fi (free to corporate accounts, paid for the general public), work desk, and a small kitchenette were all very nice. The restaurant and bar offer good food and quick service. I do have one observation, apparently someone forgot to tell management that pools in the hot desert need to be chilled in the summer months. Many of Phoenix's (as well as Las Vegas') properties discovered this years ago. DoubleTree must have missed that memo. I went swimming once and no more. The pool was as hot as a Jacuzzi and there was a dirty ring all around the top of the pool, where apparently no one has cleaned in ages! It's not a stain, it rubs off with a bit of scrubbing. The only real problem I had, which I did not discover until I had checked out and reviewed my bill, was with the giftshop. I had forgotten my swim trunks at home and went to the giftshop for the purchase, which was charged to my room. She sold me a pair of WalMart's Faded Glory trunks and I went merrily on my way without reviewing my bill. I was shocked to see that what WalMart sells for $10USD, she sold me for $50USD! But, too late now, I'm checked out and gone! I would expect a bit of a mark up, but I don't like being royally ripped off! Although, if I'm honest, part of the blame lies with me! I did not pay attention, I was too busy talking, but nevertheless, I feel a bit taken advantage of. Caveat emptor if you buy anything from the giftshop. But, all in all, it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “First time in Phoenix/Tempe”
Reviews.Author: zephyr64
Reviews.Content: Will stay here again as it was very conveniently located relative to the airport and ASU. Had a car, but next time will try public transport; the Metro goes straight to ASU, and I think is a very short walk from the hotel... hope it's short because I've never experienced heat like AZ heat before). There is some parking under a shade structure on the weekends, but during the weekdays it is reserved-parking for businesses; I think the hotel should install covered parking (why aren't solar panels absolutely everywhere here??) The complimentary breakfast buffet was good, but not open early enough (7am); they did offer some grab-and-go foods earlier than 7am though, so you're not left without breakfast. A local paper suggested all strenuous activity should take place between 4 and 7am in the summer, so I really think they should offer a complete breakfast earlier. We fit 5 people in our room as it had 2 queens and a pull-out sleeper; the sofa was pretty uncomfortable I was told by its occupant, but that's to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: Talanesea
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week for business. The hotel has it's swimming pool in the center of the complex and the noise from it echoes up like a bullhorn. The pool doesn't close until 11 and the kids screaming was intense most nights. It was great the one night the thunderstorm came through. The room service was good, but slow on picking up the trays, mine stayed outside my door almost 24 hours. The maid services was great and the place was clean. I've stayed here before and would again. There's a Chinese Cultural Center in walking distance. They have a Chinese grocery (which was awesome) and a couple of Chinese food restaurants. Oh, and the free breakfast was consistently good. Service was prompt and polite by the staff. Oh and one of the two elevators near my room was out of service the whole time. It was slow, but the stairs were easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!”
Reviews.Author: dustyroads2
Reviews.Content: this hotel is so posh, comfortable, attractive, reasonably priced, and has such excellent guest services that I would like to live there!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect start to our trip!”
Reviews.Author: Kiddoc70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after arriving on a late flight. The woman at the check-in desk was great - making us laugh despite a long, unpleasant flight experience with two young children. Breakfast in the morning was the best complimentary breakfast we've experienced. When we got on the shuttle in the morning to return to the airport to pick up our rental car, the driver went out of his way to take us right to the rental car terminal instead of dropping us at the airport like we had expected. He even got some travel brochures and marked up a map to help us plan our week-long adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Very high on my value list.”
Reviews.Author: AZlovesHI
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Doubletree Phoenix often. We are from Tucson and go to Phoenix for getaways often. This is my favorite property due to it's convenience to multiple activities and value. The property is well maintained, close to both the I-10 and 202 freeways and the light rail system, has comfortable, quiet, clean rooms, and being a suite provides plenty of room. The free breakfast buffet is never outstanding, but always more than adequate. The morning buffet staff is friendly and helpful. The front desk staff has never been anything short of friendly and helpful as well, handling special requests often. Of course, the free warm cookie is always a special treat!

Reviews.Title: “Near Sky Harbor Airport for early flight home”
Reviews.Author: leformi
Reviews.Content: We had a 7:00 am flight out so we chose doubletree and with Hilton rewards this property was even better value as we needed two rooms. My husband returned the car that evening so we wouldn't have to take thetime in the morning. The Free shuttle service that doubletree provides both to and from the airport and to a nearby restaurant are an added perk. Not to mention the warm chocolate chip cookies on arrival.We couldn't try the pool as it was closed for a sandstorm. The only problem I have is that the suites which are extremely comfortable and appear brand new are acessed from an exterior coutyard which yes might be pkeasNt in the winter in AZ bit when it is 105 out I found it not fun as Phoenix has high humidity unlike the other areas we visited in AZ . They also provide coffee,fruit,and muffins for early departures who are missing the breakfast sit down which was appreciated by all five in my family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Cbannon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Doubletree, the first night of our tour with Caravan - Grand Canyon. The Suite was comfortable, the pool was nice, the meeting facilities were adequate and the on-site bar and restaurant food and beverarges were good and reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: golfwesty
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a Business Suite as a HH Diamond. Very nice. HD TV in living area and flat screen TV in bedroom. I liked the outside entrances. The breakfast buffet was delicious. Easy drive on surface roads to airport rental car facility. I had Room Service 1 night which was reasonable in price and very good. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outdoor entrances? At a Doubletree? Really?”
Reviews.Author: shlevine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of seven for a big work trip, so I spent about $2000. I was shocked to arrive at the hotel to find that all guest rooms are accessed via external hallways. That is not really what I expect from a DubTree. The rooms are standard DubTree fair--fine, nothing fancy, large. But there's no wireless in the room...hardwired Ethernet connection, which is 2011 is just ridiculous. The property is huge, and nicely landscaped. The gym is better than most hotel gyms, though getting there from my far-distant room was a workout in and of itself. The restaurant is ok, standard DubTree fare.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: travelqueen3317
Reviews.Content: wonderful, spotlessly clean hotel near airport with free shuttle; food in their restaurant was excellent; went out of their way upon check-in to get us in our room 4 hours early; will definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Nice large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jimhere
Reviews.Content: The suites were nice and big--2 queen size beds in 1 room and a very large 2nd room with a couch and chair, desk, and frig with little sink area. The landscaping was very attractive and the pool was very nice. The hot tub was also nice and large. The breakfast buffet was great! We dropped the car off at the airport the night before we left and called for the free shuttle, which showed up in about 10 minutes. Nice place--we'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel room was great"”
Reviews.Author: dakotaeast
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice, clean, quiet. Service coming in was fine, trying to check out the next day I was ignored even though they saw me there. The restaurant is not a place I would ever go to again...50 minutes just to get a chicken sandwich and fries..the place had only a handful of people so it wasn't busy. Oh, and the food was not so great that it was worth the wait.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for our family trip”
Reviews.Author: happyfamilytrav
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay here. The courtyard area is very relaxing and pretty (with fruit trees). The pool was nice for the kids. The rooms were spacious for our family of four. We have a toddler who takes naps and goes to bed early...what I loved about the room is first, the bathroom entrance is not in the bedroom (so if the baby is sleeping, you can still use the bathroom without issue). And, the bedroom door closed soundly so you don't have to worry too much about noise disrupting sleep. You can check out our pictures here: http://wp.me/pQ3NA-rX Have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but.....”
Reviews.Author: casualtraveler2011
Reviews.Content: We had two couples in our group going to Phoenix for baseball games. We chose the Doubletree because it was a suite and we were trying to save on expenses. The hotel had a free shuttle to and from the airport. We were even offered ice cold water on our way in from the airport.! It was close to the rail system so we could get to and from downtown easily. The room was roomy for four adults. The fitness room was fine. They served a hot buffet breakfast which was different each morning. The ONLY downside was that one couple had to sleep in the living room area on a CRAPPY fold out couch that had seen better days. The bedroom bed was king size and GREAT.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and roomy”
Reviews.Author: J0-chan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on the night of 3/26/11 after seeing Lady Gaga at the US Airways Center. The room smelled nice and was clean and spacious. The bed was comfy and I liked the lapdesk that was in the bedroom. The chocolate chip cookies I was given at check in were delicious! My only complaint is that we accidentally left an extension cord with an iPod adapter attached in our room and so far it doesn't look like we'll be able to get it back. My husband called as soon as we got home and was transferred to lost & found, where he left a message that has yet to be returned. I was really hoping to get our iPod adapter back because they aren't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, It Really Is Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Tex4n
Reviews.Content: I came for an event at WestWorld in Scottsdale, and stayed at the Doubletree by the airport because the prices were the best I could find. The other reviews that say you don't hear the planes are exactly right. I never heard flights overhead. In fact, during my week stay, with the hotel ranging from 80 to 90% full, I never heard anything in the bedroom of my suite. I want my room very dark at night, and hotel rooms are notoriously light. This hotel was the second best I've ever stayed in for keeping the light leakage out. My room was located near the pool, third floor, with the bedroom facing the outside of the building, and it was quiet, dark and easily temperature controlled at night. Staff was helpful and friendly, facilities were nice--this seems to be primarily a business hotel, but even when it was filled with teens and moms in town for a faith-based women's event, I never heard much noise once I was in the bedroom. Room decor was nothing special, a bit shabby, but the room was functional, everything worked, and the bed and pillows were comfortable. Breakfast seating can be a little slow. The large and varied breakfast buffet is free to guests but they manage the access by checking everyone off by name and room number before they will seat you, so at busy times seating bottlenecks. If you are in a real rush, come early. Also, the coffee was never hot although it was served in thermos carafes at the table. I brought my own from my room or served myself from the self-serve air pumps. I wasn't sure how burdensome it would be getting to WestWorld since it was a 20 minute drive. Most days I was able to go at times to avoid the traffic; one morning I had to drive in the Scottsdale "traffic jam", not really too bad. Otherwise, it was very easy and quick access to WestWorld on two freeways. Staying by the airport made flying out early in the morning a breeze. If you're a woman traveling alone, don't be alarmed by the neighborhoods you'll drive through on the way from the airport to the hotel. The area around the hotel is well-developed; it's a business park, nicer, newer, and feels safer than the areas you travel through to get to it. When booking, I was a little concerned that many older hotels in the area have all rooms opening onto an exterior corridor. I prefer having interior access, but had a hard time finding it in the price range I wanted to pay. at the Doubletree, there were many points of access from the parking lot but they all required card keys. Once on the property, I didn't have any worries about safety at the hotel. I'd like to see free wireless in the rooms, but they did have a hotspot by the lounge area with free connectivity. I would stay at this hotel again for the same event, for a business trip, or if I needed convenient access to the airport. It was serviceable for my needs, and the price was better than comparable properties.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: travelhunterOntario
Reviews.Content: I was given an upgrade to as suite because of my gold status which should always be a good thing. The suite smelled musty or just old. There were cigarette burns in the rugs and the sofa as well. When I did mention this to the front desk, the person told me that they can't help it if people smoke in non-smoking room. Of course, I know that's true, but you can change rugs and such if there are holes in them. If this was an upgrade, I didn't even want to see the regular room they might change me too. I stayed at 11 diff Hilton properties in the span of 3 weeks and by far this was the only disapointment. I am used to having a clean nice room whether it's at a Hampton or Homewood or Doubletree etc. I so would NEVER go back there again. To top it all off, it turned out to be the most expensive on my trip through the US. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Dianne61
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, i am spending a bit of time on crutches but have decided to enjoy a vacation. The first hint that this hotel believed in service started with the person who drove the airport shuttle. He told me that I could have access to a wheelchair at the hotel for as long as we were there and he was right. The person at the desk also believes in service. She found us a suite on the main floor and it was beautiful. We enjoyed the meal in the restaurant. We felt special from beginning to end.

Reviews.Title: “Warm cakes at the entrance”
Reviews.Author: Krzysiek23
Reviews.Content: First thing - warm cakes at check in. Second - huge suit with 2 bedrooms. I have never been before in such comfortable hotel. Clean, quiet, great view, nice swimming pool. Nice and tasty breakfast. Very close to the airport. Other things - amazing! Apart from the parking place - which is too little. Everything else was perfect. Nothing more to add.

Reviews.Title: “ok not great”
Reviews.Author: forrest73
Reviews.Content: the stay here was ok but not great. our room smelled a bit funny like they had used too much cleaning product over a long period of time. we tried to air it out but it was a bit bothersome. the rooms themselves were a bit drab and in need of an update. however, the service and location were great overall although our experience with one of the front desk people was less than great. he was obviously tired and somewhat annoyed and snapped at us a bit. that would be my only qualm. bottom line: decent place to stay if you have to head out on an early flight in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Hilton knows exactly how to please hotel guests”
Reviews.Author: grzegorz_krol
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located in the vicinity of the airport, but far enough not to have harmful noises above your head. I checked it out while swimming in an outdoor swimming-pool. The room was actually an en-suite with comfy bathroom, a living-room with a little office-like part of it and huge sleeping-room which was absolutely fantastic: quiet and peaceful. you just can't wake up! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: theorchidlady
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel four times over the past two years. We usually fly into Phoenix late in the evening and this is a great hotel to stay at before traveling on to our destination. The rooms are clean and spacious. The beds are very comfortable. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful. The usual Doubletree hospitality includes chocolate chip cookies with free bottles of water. The free full breakfast is really great. I loved their bisquits and gravy, but they offer full range of breakfast foods and meats etc. Hotel is next door to China Cultural Center so you can also walk over for great Chinese dinner. Hotel is easy access, comfortable and quiet. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, beautiful suites that are clean...”
Reviews.Author: Ronwalker
Reviews.Content: This suite I stayed in had rooms with interesting and comfortable design. The living area had a nice sofa and old fashion floor and table lamps that were like home. The eating area was nice and had a large table to work on as well. The bedroom had this nice window that angled toward the head of the bed so you could see the sky at night! Everything clean and fresh. Staff nice. Great pool and Jacuzzi. Nice restaraurant and free bkfst. Price not bad at all. The only down sides: the coffee in the room was horrible (those little bag things with dripper). Also, the exercise room was sparse and small.

Reviews.Title: “Owner is scrimping on upkeep. Shabby shape”
Reviews.Author: WaterloggedOregonian
Reviews.Content: Be prepared to spend a long time waiting at the airport to get picked up by the shuttle. The driver told me they're not allowed to come any more frequently than 20 minutes or so. A cab won't take you -- it's too close. My door wouldn't operate because the knob was broken. The coffee maker spilled all over the counter instead of going into the cup. The banquet staff only trickled out entrees, keeping guests waiting for the lunch buffet. The bed is very comfortable, and the staff is nice, but they can't compensate for the cheapskates operating the hotel. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BEST Service, incredible staff, awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: WPTMead
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites Phoenix and was overwhelmed by the kind staff, genuine warmth, and great product. This hotel offers a terrific breakfast, great internet access, and a team that makes you feel like you are the most important person on the planet!! I loved the TVs that swivel to face the desk with a full roation so I could see the screen and not just a corner of the image - Great touch! It is this kind of attention to detail that really matters. My room was spotless, and did I mention the service is over the top? Book here when you are in town!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for wedding reception!”
Reviews.Author: Phx77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very impressed with the Doubletree Guest Suites and staff where we held our wedding reception on 10/23/10. Kristina Humphrey and staff did an amazing job putting together our cocktail hour and dinner reception. The food and drink service were excellent! We had many family members stay overnight and they were all very pleased with the breakfast buffet, roomy hotel suites, shuttle service to/from airport and of course, the yummy cookies upon arrival. Kristina Humphrey was a pleasure to work with and helped us with all of our wedding related questions and made our wedding reception an amazing event. We were also happy to find out that since we had stayed there overnight, we were able to park our car there for a week while we went on our honeymoon. We were able to use the Doubletree shuttle to and from the airport which was a benefit for us! We definitely recommend the Doubletree Guest Suites for any events and visitors staying in the Phoenix area! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Dava83
Reviews.Content: I took a quick trip down to Phoenix and had the privilege of staying at this hotel. Everything about this hotel is great. I was greeted with a warm smile from Doug as I checked in. He was very helpful and friendly. I got up to the room and was really impressed with the size, cleanliness and design of the suite. Just about everything from the flat screen TV, to the comfortable couch and chair was nice. My absolute favorite part about my stay, however, was the bedding in the suites. I've stayed in MANY hotels, and the bedding found at this property is some of the best I've ever slept in. The breakfast in the morning was superb also. Great experience at a great hotel. I would recommend it to just about anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - pity about the shuttle”
Reviews.Author: travelquestLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was excellent - clean, comfortable, lots of space, good breakfast. The airconditioning was a marvel - instead of noisily pouring cold stale air out as so many do, it very quietly kept the room at optimum temperature. We were only passing through, so only spent one night, but would happily have spent more time there. Two things let it down. First the reception staff. Not unfriendly, but rather offhand, and when, very tired after a long flight and trying to decipher an unfamiliar accent, we didn't immediately understand what was being said, the man on the desk was, well, not quite rude, but certainly not gracious But our main complaint is that shuttle. We called three times from the airport before the shuttle came. Each time we were told '10 minutes', but in the end it took an hour! Had we known we would simply have taken a taxi - after all, it's not very far. Returning to the airport, we came down 5 minutes before the shuttle was due to leave, and waited where we were told. 10 minutes later there was still no sign of the driver (though the shuttle bus was there). We asked at the desk, and the woman rang the driver. 5 minutes later the driver finally appeared, saying he had come at the appropriate time but no passengers were there - but we had been there, very conspicuously, waiting.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I had expected”
Reviews.Author: MItravelerforbus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not my favorite hilton hotel near the Phoenix airport. Upon checking in, I was not told that the internet service was down. Later I called the front desk and was told it was down but might be up any minute. What they failed to tell me is that the internet had been down for several days. The hotel is older and I found the concrete walls to be gloomy.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: DJELP
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the room and the excellent breakfast buffet, the check in was ok. However I went later to ask about South Mounat and the awarded winning female clerk sneered, giggle, and ultimatley got to her having a fear of heights. Never did get an answer.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: paulaStillwater_Ok
Reviews.Content: For the cost of this hotel it was overpriced....yes, the room was nice and typical Doubletree style with the cookies and nice suite, etc but the front desk staff left much to be desired.....not much info about our questions, not friendly, not helpful. We arrived when it was 100 plus degrees and it took all night for our room to cool down. Breakfast buffet on Sunday morning was fresh but limited array of items....

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome to Southwest hospitality”
Reviews.Author: 2kayak
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding, right from the shuttle from the airport as easy as picking up the phone next to baggage claim. Warm cookies upon check-in and water with lemon available in the lobby. Staff pays attention to detail, is friendly and helpful. Although we arrived early we were given a room right away. Large pool area, happy hour with discounted cocktails, great breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dmello22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, spacious,comfortable, and affordable. The staff was very helpful, friendly and professional. We stayed two days on the 5th floor. We had a view of the airport. We travel frequently and after our stay at the phoenix doubletree we have decided we only stay in doubletree hotels from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, very clean. Continental...”
Reviews.Author: pcarlbe
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, very clean. Continental breakfast is fantastic. Restaurant menu is quite limited. Pool is nice and parking was adequate. Air conditioner was noisy and we did request someone to look at it but do not know if anyone ever did. Easy to get to and get around from.

Reviews.Title: “Sort of an odd place; below DoubleTree/Hilton standards”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I didn't really enjoy my stay at this hotel. I got a bad taste from the very beginning when I called the hotel after a late arrival at the airport and asked for the shuttle. The woman on the phone was VERY inpatient while explaining the layout of the Phoenix airport (confusing!, as the hotel's shuttle only picks up on one side despite both sides having signs for hotel shuttles -- not sure why), bossy (for instance, when I tried to explain at the beginning of the call that I'd already gotten my bags, etc., she insisted on following her script) and pretty gruff. I then arrived and there was a long line in the lobby to check-in -- that happens sometimes, but it was frustrating to see only one person working the front desk even as the line continued to build. I ordered a room service dinner. Mediocre. My shrimp caesar salad had TINY little shrimp, clearly frozen, and it took 40 minutes to get delivered. The average level of service continued the next morning. The hotel does not put bills under the door, as the vast majority of Hilton and DoubleTree properties do. Instead, you have to check-out at the desk or leave your e-mail addresses in a drop box on your floor. When I checked-out, I needed the shuttle back to the airport. I was asked to wait for 20 minutes -- the ENTIRE time, the shuttle driver stood at the bell desk and did nothing. (I understand the shuttle runs on a schedule, but in my experience many other properties make an extra run when it's slow. Sort of annoying to just sit there and stare at the driver as he does nothing while you wait. Just as with the night before on the phone, I got the impression that the hotel is very "by the book" instead of providing personalized service.) I found the hotel's layout to be odd. It is an all external-hallways property with a very 1970s architectural vibe: heavy on the concrete, earth tones, etc. I just don't find a concrete "hallway" with brick walls very appealing. Some of the floors have bridges that connect sections of the hotel while others do not. I didn't necessarily feel unsafe as you do in some external-hallway properties, but the overall feeling was not one of high-quality or luxury. It sort of felt like an old Holiday Inn. The rooms are all suites, which is nice. My room was clean, although the carpet was worn. I also thought the room was dark; this is because the living room window looks right out on the exterior hallway and in order to let in light you had to let the world see into your room as they walk to their rooms, which I don't care to do. I thought the public areas of the hotel looked worn as well -- the restaurant and lobby were utilitarian and the elevators were dirty (fingerprints, etc. all over the glass). The place is also noisy, as everyone's rolling bags make noise on the concrete and the pool is right in the middle of everyone's rooms. A lot of people probably go ga-ga over the free breakfast buffet. I suppose that's a touch not usually included as part of everyone's room rate (although as an elite Hilton HHonors member you are often provided breakfast), but I thought the breakfast was pretty average: a bowl of melon that looked like it came from a can, over-cooked potatoes, rock hard biscuits, etc. Personally, I'd rather pay for a freshly cooked breakfast than go to a mobscene buffet with average food. I imagine a lot of people like this property for the big pool and free breakfast; as a business traveller accustomed to DoubleTree/Hilton properties delivering at a pretty high standard, I didn't think this property lived up to the standard of the brand. Next time I need to stay near the Phoenix airport, I'll look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “If possible, I would always stay at a Doubletree Suite”
Reviews.Author: KHalvy
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through priceline and paid $89 per night. Unbelievablel deal. We arrived on the late side, but there were still warm cookies waiting for us (something I didn't realize was part of their welcome). Very quick check in. We were also given directions to get to the airport and rental car check-in since we'd be leaving early and might be in a rush. Our rooms -- well, it was just fantastic to have two separate rooms, two separate televisions, a small fridge, a microwave, small sink and cupboards to use. The couch was comfy, the beds even comfier. Closets with plenty of space. The one downside was that, because our bathroom was handicap accessible, there was no lip to the bath, so the water tended to make a bit of a mess on the floor. We used the pool and hot tub. Both were well kept and towels were available, even at night. In the morning, breakfast is offered, but since we were leaving early, we didn't get the hot breakfast...but muffins and coffee and some fruit were available. Check-out was quick and painless. I wish we had more DoubleTrees were I live in NH...but whenever I travel, I will certainly look for this hotel before others. One of the reasons we chose the hotel was because of its proximity to the airport...so it's not exactly close to all things downtown...but there was little to no traffic/airport noise and the grounds and surroundings were well kept and attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Really great business hotel, not so great for families on vacation”
Reviews.Author: webeenthere
Reviews.Content: Very nice, very clean, great full buffet breakfast complimentary. All the staff were extremely helpful, the location made it very easy to get around even though it's more a business hotel than a vacation hotel. Only problem was some of the rooms back onto the freeway which is noisy. Other than that, you'll enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: lojo34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 1 night at the Doubletree in Phoenix. We utilized the free shuttle from the airport, which was efficient and handy since we weren’t able to rent a car due to our last minute travel plans. Check-in was easy and we got our yummy cookies. The room was nice – sitting area with large flat-screen TV and comfortable bed in the bedroom. I can honestly say that I didn’t notice the noise that several other people mentioned, so perhaps we were on the side of the hotel that was quiet. Overall, I really liked this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but noisy”
Reviews.Author: LoneRngr
Reviews.Content: A decent place to stay. Pros included free breakfast, computers to surf the web (in lounge), big flat screen TVs in the rooms, free cookies on arrival, free airport shuttle, pool, and close to airport. Cons included noisy (from nearby highways, airport, and parking lot with thin windows), old showers, overpriced gift shop, and a bit dated appearance. Staff was helpful but not overly so. Overall a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised at the great stay.”
Reviews.Author: nymetsfanz
Reviews.Content: My family (2 children ages 6 and 20 months) stayed here from Monday to Thursday. This really was a great place that we will come back to again. Check in was quick and easy and you are greated with the best cookies you will ever eat. Parking was free. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous. They put a lot of work and effort into making them beautiful and it shows. We had a 1 bedroom suite that was cozy for the 4 of us but we used the microwave and fridge to stock up on non-restaurant non-junk food. The bedroom is large with a very comfortable bed and pillows and our son didn't complain about the pull out sofa bed. There is a very large high definition TV which I think convinced my wife to make us buy HDTV when we get back. The pool is very warm and can be accessed all day in any weather. My son swam there everyday for hours. Most of the time there were no towels at the pool but housekeeping was right around the corner and they would give me some as they were folding them. One bad thing is the carpet in the rooms. Our feet were black after walking on the floors. It is kind of gross. I felt so bad we would wash our feet at night before getting into the white sheets and comforter. It doesn't look dirty but your feet don't lie. The morning breakfast is the bomb. It is a sit down style buffet with many options and new things each day (i.e. biscuts and gravy, crepes, waffles, etc). It does close a little early (9 am) and they don't play around. At 9:02 they are closing up. Try to get there early. Everyone comes at 8:30 and you may have to wait 20+ minutes for a table. Tip not included for cost of breakfast so take a few bucks or you can charge it to your room. Also, they have to-go boxes so you can take some things back to your room for later-just ask a server for a box. Jaymi was an awesome help for us and took very good care of us. Free internet near the restaurant entrance that was handy to have and helpful to be able to print off maps and directions to various ballparks (free printing). Housekeeping for very good and will come clean if you are in your room or not. I never saw them so I don't when they come around. We left at different times each day and when we returned everything was cleaned with new towels (they even folded my sons blankie and pillow and set them on the edge of the bed for him). They told me the Oakland A's were staying there but I never saw one person that resembled a professional athlete or anyone wearing anything that had the A's emblem on it. Go figure. We went to many baseball games and access to/from the hotel is quick and easy. The 202 is right around the corner. I was worried about hearing jet noises because it is close to the airport; no an issue. The planes land east/west and parallel to the hotel so you don't hear their engine noise. The pool closes at 11 and it was quiet after that. All in all it was a great price for a very comfortable hotel. The staff was very helpful and we would defnitely comeback again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, lots of outside noise at night”
Reviews.Author: caligirlburb
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree is part of Hilton Hotels. I booked a business class suite and was assigned the 5th Floor. The room was nice -- typical Hilton. The hotel itself is just okay. The room service food is less than average. The location is safe, if you need to stay near the airport. The front desk customer service is less than average. I wouldn't stay here again because I couldn't sleep all night. Trains pass by all night long and sound loud horns. The windows are not double paned, so it wakes you every time. Additionally, the freeway is next door, so you get freeway noise all night, along with the occasional airplane.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: geebo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Even during spring training season the hotel was quiet. Furnishing are nice, rooms are sparkling and roomy as you'd expect with an all-suite hotel. Staff is generally friendly, and the breakfast buffet is good. If you can get a deal, don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value--Wonderful Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MIKEandPAM
Reviews.Content: The Exterior of the courtyard is a little funky and the room doors open to the outside but all that is of little consequence once you stay there a few days. The staff is very helpful and the shuttle drivers, Paulino, Ray and Pete are a great help. The room is clean, beds comforatble, pool inviting and the breakfast was a feast. I'm on the road a lot some I'm use to the standard b'fast. But this is a 9 on a scale of 1-10. I even read the dining hours wrong and they accomodated me as though I was a special guest. We had a light dinner there one night and that was great too!. Great Service ,Great waitstaff and delishes food. 8 mins from the airport and the drivers also brought us to and back from the botanical gardens. If we go back.....We are stating at the PHX Doubletree!! thanks DT

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great room, just don't count on breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: rock1961
Reviews.Content: Traveled to AZ for the first time last week and stayed twice at this Doubletree. 2 nights upon our arrival, 1 night on our departure. Hotel is very nice, great room, great service. The rate was good and included a breakfast buffett. The problem was trying to get breakfast. The lines were long, the wait even longer, we ended up going somewhere else all 3 mornings. I can truly say that this was our only complaint. I would stay here again without a doubt, think it was great even without getting breakfast. We had a king suite, separate bedroom, pullout sofa, 2 tv's, small kitchen, fridge, microwave, coffee maker. Hair dryer in bathroom, iron/board, abundence of pillows, great bed, just a great room. Did have wireless internet in room, was $9.99 a day, or you could go down to the lobby for free. Daughter used the pool and hot tub several times. 24 hour fitness center... Overall stay was great, just go out to eat breakfast is the hotel is full. Wait is not worth it. We did have dinner in the restaurant our first night, food was very good......

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !”
Reviews.Author: livn2vaca
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great ! We just completed a 5 day/4 night adventure this weekend after landing and departing from Phoenix. Stayed in 4 different hotels from Sedona to Flagstaff to the Grand Canyon and lastly, the Doubletree Guest Suites in Phoenix. I chose this airport from the reviews I read, plus the fact that they had the airport shuttle and they were close to the airport. If our other hotels we stayed in were this nice, I wouldn't have one single complaint about the trip. This was by far the nicest. We had a 2 room suite, which had a huge bedroom with two super comfy pillow top queen beds, and a separate living room area with a sofabed and loveseat and nice big flat screen TV. The pool area was beautiful, the hot choc chip cookies at check in were a nice treat, the buffet breakfast was yummy, the room was clean, the staff helpful....everything was just perfect !

Reviews.Title: “really mediocre”
Reviews.Author: montanalovevacation
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews here on TA, thought we'd stay in this hotel for our last night. We both agreed it was not a good deal at all, weird room layout, confusing to get around the property itself, party full of drunk fighting wedding guests all over the property when we checked in. To top it off, one of the staff gave us totally wrong information about returning our rental car, saying that since we'd rented with Enterprise, we could leave it at the hotel and take their shuttle and the company would pick the car up for no cost! When we finally talked to someone at enterprise, they said no, in fact, that was not the case and the hotel had given this wrong info to others! It really messed up our departure as we then had to make a run for the airport and return the car! On the positive side, the cookies were good, and the bed was super comfy, but i don't think I'd recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: BevRostelle
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with 2 teenagers and for the price we paid (just under $100/night included full breakfast buffet) it was definitely worth it. The rooms are spacious but need some updating, but bed was comfortable and rooms clean. Has refrigerator, microwave handy. The neighborhood is rough around the airport, but we were just out of the "shady" part of town and felt safe (around business buildings). Wouldn't recommend for a long stay as ours was only 2 nights.....but close to the airport and great if you have an early morning flight. Also, it was quiet even if the hotel seemed quite full. Not a luxury hotel, but more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal - Comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MarDeeS
Reviews.Content: We stayed December 26/09 to January 2/10. The hotel shuttle picked us up at the airport. Short wait, not unreasonable. Hotel shuttle also offered a ride for us to pick up and return our rental vehicle from the airport. Front desk and concierge gave good service. The hotel restaurant was nice, a little pricey, but the food was good. The morning buffet was good. Not a lot of change day to day, however, was nice to have a cooked breakfast to start our day of exploring Arizona. Computers are set up by the restaurant with a 30 minute use limit. Great service. The pool and hot tub were warm and clean. Enjoyed this daily. Rooms are pretty sound proof. Did not hear new year's eve partiers come in after we brought in new year. Close to airport and central for local attractions. Good value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Suberb value”
Reviews.Author: agsmith50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice if you are looking for solid value and comfort, in a central location. It is strategically located as a central hub, with popular destinations accessible as "not too distant spokes", in an otherwise sprawled metro Phoenix. It is very close to the airport , as well as the Desert Botanical Garden and the Zoo. The hotel serves business travelers and value conscious vacationers. A nutritious buffet was free and the suites were spacious, clean and comfortable. You will not find the latest chic furnishings or resort accouterments of dubious value, but you will also not find an inflated final bill. Overall, an excellent place to stay while in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location for seeing sights.”
Reviews.Author: Denise0955
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel. We found everyone to be friendly and helpful. Great breakfast buffet included in price. We were seated at table and then went up to buffet. No hunting for tables. I asked for extra pillows when I booked hotel and they were in our room upon arrival. Rooms desperately need renovation to freshen things up. Employee said they are hoping to do that next year. Great location, easy access to main expressways and nearby cities.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay”
Reviews.Author: irishguyinaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is much like any other airport or business hotel. Nice furnishings, comfortable, clean, great pool, free (full) breakfast, blah blah blah. There are 2 amenities that aren't found on any brochure. The staff and the quiet! Every staff member greets you with a smile and a hello. There is a great sense of teamwork among them. That goes along way. Then, there's the quiet. It's less than a mile from the airport but I've never been disturbed by airport noise or other guests for that matter. If these qualities aren't important to you then consider the rooms. Each is a 1 bedroom suite and are very comfortable and equipped for doing business. Each has a microwave, fridge and coffee maker with Wolfgang Puck coffee. Yeah, he makes coffee too. The breakfast is a 15 foot buffet. There's an expanded business center now called an internet cafe. The only down side is that there are few restaurants within walking distance. The restaurant in the hotel is always fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to airport and downtown, value for money”
Reviews.Author: BusterBrewsky
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business for two nights. Good location near airport and not far from downtown Phoenix and also easy to get to restaurants of Scotsdale at night. Before booking I checked with the downtown Phoenix hotels and they were more than double what we paid at the Doubletree. It took 10 minutes by car to get to our downtown meeting. The rooms were suites with a seperate bedroom so it was easy to work and meet in the room. The buffett breakfast was good also and included in the price. Shuttle to the airport as well. Good business location, good value, good services when in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: traveler999K
Reviews.Content: I'm very easy to please and can't recall ever making a complaint like this in the past, but Doubletree was flatly dishonest. The NO SMOKING room stunk of smoke, not a little, but a lot. When I stated this to the lady at the front desk, she looked at the computer screen, told me I was wrong, and that they could not move me as the hotel was full. The Free shuttle service within two miles of the hotel that was clearly advertised on their website was flatly refused once I was there. When I referenced their website, they just replied "We only offer that service to the airport." So for each of the four days as I was taking cabs back and forth I walked by a sign at the lobby entrance that stated "We offer shuttle service on demand but make an airport run on the half hour regardless". When I called the front desk stating I needed to be taken to the airport and referenced the sign, the employee at the front desk denied it existed. When I reached the lobby the sign had been removed. Unbelievable. The shuttle did eventually show up, but left basically when the driver finally got around to it, even though I wasn't the only one waiting to go. I could go on, but isn't that enough?

Reviews.Title: “Doubletree OK but not Great!”
Reviews.Author: Zell
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Doubletree Guest Suites on 2 Friday nights as we arrived in Phoenix on our way to Sedona and as we were leaving Phoenix. As reported in earlier reviews, the suite layout is very similar to Embassy Suites... living area as one enters and the bedroom in the rear with the bathroom in the middle off a small hallway. The upholstery in the living room is very dated... dark and almost dingy looking. However, the beds were very comfortable with numerous feather pillows. Front desk staff is very friendly and greets all staff with warm chocolate chip cookies. However, the restaurant staff needs improvement. Although the free breakfast buffet is excellent, I was never acknowledged by wait staff to ask if I would like coffee... even though the restaurant was only about 1/4 occupied. In fact, the ONLY contact I had at the restaurant was with the hostess who seated me, who never smiled, I noted this on the comment sheet left on the table which also asked for a gratuity -- a pen was included making it easy for the customer to add a $ amount. I added both a comment and a small gratuity because the food was good although the friendliness was NOT. The decor of the public areas - lobby, restaurant, conference rooms are very attractive. On the 2nd Friday night we stayed, we were assigned to a 2nd floor suite in the back by the laundry and overlooking the large and very noisy AC/furnace and utility area. Our entry gate (#5) on the ground level had us walking by the multiple laundry carts which were left very messy and disorganized... a very poor introduction to the hotel guest area. Not only was there no view we could not have seen out because the outside windows were absolutely filthy! Again, the decor in this room was very dated, although the beds were quite comfortable. The AC in this room had some problems and the thermostat was flashing that the battery was low. I was finally able to get the temperature adjusted to a comfortable level. I called the front desk and requested a room change and was told there were no other rooms available... although the parking lot was practically empty at the time we checked in. My reservation request had been made approximately 1 month in advance and I had requested an upper level room (in fact, I have a standardized note on my hotel profile). We are Diamond level Hilton Honors members and are almost always assigned good accommodations. It is my understanding that room assignments are made either the day prior to the reservation or early in the AM of the reservation. If the individual making the room assignments had actually READ the reservation and assigned accordingly, perhaps our suite would have been better. The hair dryer did not work in the morning. However, when I called, a man from maintenance came immediately and got it operating correctly.
