(I thought housekeeping was supposed to ensure things in the room were operating correctly before they leave the room each day... at least this is what I learned when I took a hotel management courses). Another TA reviewer also noted that the ice and vending machines are on alternate floors. This is accurate, so that on floor #2 one has to go either up or down a level to obtain ice. The hotel has moved their Business Center to just outside the restaurant and bar area and now refer to it as an Internet cafe. There are 4 computer terminals that are easy to use with comfortable seating. Although the paper in the printer had run out, it was easy to locate more paper in the cabinet below and refill the paper tray. The bar tender seems to have the responsibility of checking in with guests using the terminal to see if any help is needed and he did come by to see if we needed assistance. The next time we are in the Phoenix area, we may try the Embassy Suites which is nearby... hopefully, the rooms will be more updated, room assignment requests will be honored and restaurant staff will be more friendly. By the way, the front desk has a preprinted handout that provides specific directions from the hotel to the rental car return at the airport. Be sure and pick this up as getting in and out of the airport from the rental car garages can be very complicated. Signage upon leaving the rental car garage is very poor and construction on the perimeters of the airport is very heavy.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are a little stale smelling.”
Reviews.Author: Check9
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night because the reviews seemed so good and I noticed somewhere that the rooms had be updated in 2006. The only thing that seemed updated was the vanity in the bathroom and the beds. Also, it appeared they had added a little kitchen area with a decent size refrigerator. Other than that the furniture and decor seemed to be from the 80's. The room had a very old stale smell to it which was not appealing. The hotels free breakfast buffet was very nice. The pool looked nice but I didn't use it. The grounds are very beautiful. It is also very close to the airport but I didn't hear any airport noise. I would not stay there again as I prefer something a little newer that doesn't smell. I noticed on another review that someone else had mentioned the smell too.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient, comfortable and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sedona-Joel
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite places to stay. My wife an I always stay here before and after taking a flight out of the area - or out of the country. The rooms are large, clean and very comfortable. The front desk staff is really great and very accommodating. They serve a complimentary hot and cold breakfast buffet - with lots of varierty. The eggs are always hot and so is the coffee. Over the past 10 years I have stayed at this hotel over 50 times and have never been disappointed. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, roomy, reasonable - what could be better”
Reviews.Author: beedancertoo
Reviews.Content: I Love the extra space in the suite...comfy for one day or extended stays.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with very good breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: lewf
Reviews.Content: My fiance' and I stayed at this Doubletree for two days last week. The hotel and rooms were clean, very comfortable, and good location....proximity to airport. The restaurant was good and we especially enjoyed the breakfast buffet! Overall, we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Handy Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: waterlgged
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while attending the NASCAR race and exploring the Phoenix area before heading to the Grand Canyon. I used Hilton points, so the stay was free, but we still got great service. Our room was really great with a separate living room area. The hotel was arranged nicely with all the room entrances on the courtyard side of the building overlooking the central pool. We could also see south mountain once we walked out the front door of our room on the top floor. As we approached the hotel, it was night and appeared that this maybe wasn't the best part of town (as I had read in previous reviews), but it wasn't terrible either and we had no problems. Breakfast was included for us as I have Hilton status. It was buffet style and was quite good, with service to match. This was definitely one of the more elaborate doubletree's i've stayed at and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone visiting the area or who needs to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Such a deal...”
Reviews.Author: NaKoa
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days in Phoenix on leisure and booked directly with Hilton Honors @ $79 weekday and $49 weekend rate. Location of the hotel can't be beat, within a couple of minutes of the airport and a bunch of freeway on-ramps, but in a quiet business area. Despite the location, I could not hear a single aircraft or car during our entire stay. The hotel itself is large 4-5 stories high surrounding a central courtyard, with a large swimming pool and sauna and an area with numerous canopied tables and chairs for lounging, although no one could be seen lounging due to the heat. We had a room overlooking the pool, with the bedroom facing 44th Street, but again no street noise or sounds from the pool or street due to the excellent sound insulation. We had a "standard" one bedroom suite, with a sink, fridge, work desk, pullout couch and a separate bedroom. A large (46"?) TV with HD channels (yowza!) in the living area with another standard tube TV in the bedroom. The bed was very comfortable with your choice of feather or foam pillows. Large bathroom with complimentary bath products (that barely fit in my suitcase : ] ). Included in the room charge was breakfast in the Belvedere Restaurant that also serves lunch and dinner, so you're not stuck down in a converted laundry room or basement. The buffet breakfast is good with hot eggs, bacon, sausage and the usual fruits, cereals, danish, muffins, etc. Very good value. If you're up before breakfast, they have a muffin and coffee station for takeouts in the morning. (Did I mention the warm chocolate chip cookie on check-in?) We usually accessed our room from a rear (all entrances require you use your hotel keycard) parking area, next to the hotel shuttle buses and we always felt safe and secure, day or night. Metrolink and buses stop right close by the hotel, but we opted for a rental car. (how do those Phoenicians stand outside in 112 degree heat?) We also made use of the excellent workout center, adjacent to the pool with a couple of super-duper treadmills and elipticals (with flat screen TV's attached), full set of free weights, exercise balls and another giant flat screen TV and of course, the dreaded scale! There are even small laundry facilites on each floor and ice/vending machines on every other. Last but not least, the staff was uniformly warm and welcoming. From the assistant manager who checked us in, to the room maids who kept our room immaculate despite our best efforts, to the laundry room attendants who always greeted us when we passed by. Great hotel, which I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: statdoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for one night because I had an early-morning flight from Phoenix. My 'executive suite" was very large, pleasantly decorated, and included free high-speed internet service. The suite was equipped with a sink, a small refrigerator (mine wasn't working) and a microwave, but no stove or hotplate and no dishes or cutlery. I didn't try the restaurant, but had an excellent club sandwich from room service. Missed the free breakfast buffet because I had a 6am flight. (The hotel also provides packaged muffins in the lobby for pre-breakfast departures, but they didn't look very appetizing.) The hotel operates an efficient shuttle that runs to and from the airport every 30 minutes around the clock.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: mexicanhat
Reviews.Content: Everything was huge: the room, the super-comfortable bed with crisp white linens and the the TV! Even the free breakfast choice was substantial. A superior airport hotel for the money. The staff were terrific too.

Reviews.Title: “With one exception very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: osuffan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on June 10, 2009 for one night. We used our Hilton Points. Very nice hotel. No problems with the reservations. My wife requested a portable fan for white noise and the request was promptly filled (it didn't help...see below). The breakfast buffet was good but I still like Embassy Suites better. They had scrambled eggs, regular and southwest style. Bacon and sausage. Assorted juices and breads. Potatoes and fruit. The pool area is very nice. The room was nice and clean and the king bed was very comfortable. My sons sleeper sofa on the other hand had a mattress that had to be the original one. These need to be changed out. My only real complaint was that I asked for a quite room. Since we checked in early and the hotel was not busy this should not have been a problem. We were given room 417. This was a corner room with nobody above you. HOWEVER it was quite possibly the closest room to the busy street in the front of the hotel. It was very noisy all night long with the traffic. I wore ear plugs so it didn't bother me. But my wife, who can sleep through just about anything said this was the worst nights sleep she had on vacation. I let her check us out because I didn't want to get into it with the front desk. I would stay here again just not anywhere around room 417.

Reviews.Title: “Nice suites - great location”
Reviews.Author: hernfam
Reviews.Content: Suites were very roomy and nice. Desk was very good. Couch and TV were nice. Very close to airport and light rail. Took the light rail to Tempe. Very easy.

Reviews.Title: “A spectacular room for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Maggiefeline
Reviews.Content: We just spent one night at the Doubletree Guest Suites at the Phoenix airport. The rooms (living room, bedroom, and bathroom) were very clean. The linens and towels were luxe. This hotel is an amazing value. There is a charge for Wifi in the rooms. However, Wifi is available free of charge in the lobby. Also, there is a business center with three computers and internet connections. The swimming pool is very large. The restaurant service was very polite, however a bit slow. Cookies were yummy. Overall, a terrific experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SunGoddess1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights preceeding a Caravan Tour. We arrived almost two full days prior to the tour beginning, so we were looking for things to do. The manager on duty was very helpful and pleasant. While we did not find Phoenix very interesting, the hotel was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “hottest phonix”
Reviews.Author: caseyChennai
Reviews.Content: I had stayed there for a day and the hotel is Good

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: Coolfallday
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Doubletree Suites in different cities and have always had pleasant experiences. Our stay at the Doubletree Gateway Center was no different. We enjoyed a two room suite with two queen beds and a pull out couch. The accommodations were clean, updated and comfortable. A big screen TV in high definition was a pleasant surprise. The buffet breakfast is bountiful and delicious. Shuttle service to and from the hotel was convenient. This hotel is very close to the airport, but you will not notice air traffic from your suite. There are no restaurants or shopping within walking distance. The hotel has only one restaurant, so you will need to drive elsewhere if you want variety or less expensive options. If you do rent a car, please consider Enterprise @ 2834 N. 44th Street. It was much cheaper to rent out of that location rather than the airport, and we were able to leave the car at the hotel at the conclusion of our trip

Reviews.Title: “Deserves the Accolades”
Reviews.Author: rrakoczy
Reviews.Content: Normally I write a lot, but I am finding it hard not to repeat the other reviews, so I will just sum up this place as concisely as possible: This hotel is uniquely designed, with large, very comfortable suites that are a pleasure to stay in. The staff is wonderful, and the hotel has everything you would need, from a wonderful pool to very modern exercise equipment. I loved every minute of staying there. The hotel's location is less than 5 minutes from the airport and within walking distance of a couple restaurants and gas stations. The airport shuttle also runs on time and they have free Wi-Fi in the lobby. A great experience and I can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, standard business class”
Reviews.Author: wordub
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I had a short meeting with one of the companies in the Gateway Center. The rate was good and the room was spacious. A two room suite with a small bathroom. Flat screen TV in the living area. A limited room service menu. food was ok, not spectacular. The water pressure was poor. The amenities were all Nutrogena. The bed was comfortable...a bit too soft for my taste but I slept well. There is a microwave, coffee maker and a fridge. I received comp bottled water. There is an on-site restaruant with a free buffet breakfast. The eggs were cold though. But it was free. Pretty standard fare for the business traveler. I personally like hotels that have a bit more style. There was not much to do in the area. It is in a corporate park. This hotel is just a couple of mins. from Sky Harbor Airport, though you never hear any jets. I might try a different location next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Fine Staff”
Reviews.Author: danielbeez
Reviews.Content: We moved to this hotel after a bad experience at the Tempe Sheraton Four Points. What a difference, like going from purgatory to heaven. Staff was friendly and helpful, room was beautiful and spacious, pool was very nice and relaxing. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: mbmcl
Reviews.Content: This very pleasant hotel is close to the Phoenix airport but you don't have a problem with airport noise. They do provide a 24 hour airport shuttle. Efficient check in and free chocolate chip cookies. The rooms are true two room suites with a living area with couch, chair and large screen tv, a kitchen dining are with a small table, and a nice bedroom. Plenty of closet and drawer space. There is a very pleasant interior courtyard with outdoor pool, hot tub, fountains and tables. This Doubletree provides a complimentary buffet breakfast which was quite ample--fruit, cereals, pastries, eggs, juices, coffee, etc. It is served in their restaurant (we didn't actually eat any other meals there, so I can't speak to the restaurant/bar itself). They have a small business center with free internet access and free printing (very convenient for boarding passes, etc.) The hotel is in an office type area, but is within a couple of blocks of the Chinese Cultural Center of Phoenix, which includes several restaurants. We went to the Szechuan restaurant which was very good and quite inexpensive. There is also a very interesting Asian market there which was fun to browse.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: wistraveler09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient to the Phoenix airport and the rental return center which was important on this trip. From the moment we came, the staff was friendly and helpful! I had called ahead to talk to the concierge to make a reservation for a city tour and when I got to the hotel, he had made some calls and even remembered by name and knew what room I was staying in. It made me feel like they really wanted me to feel at home. Everyone at the front desk treated you like a friend rather than a customer. LOVED THE COOKIES!!!! They are the best and were a welcome treat when we arrived. The hotel restaurant has a smaller menu than some hotels, but the food was very good and not outrageously priced. The only downside to this hotel is that there is nothing much around it, however they do offer shuttle service to the downtown area. Our room was beautiful and very clean. (Important when you have your elderly mom with you!). It has an outside entrance to the rooms as opposed to a inside hall, however I never felt uncomfortable walking to my room. The room had a sitting area and then a separate bedroom and bath. It was nicely set up and allowed each of us to have some space to ourselves in the evening. It was a little cool to take in the pool, but the grounds including the pool were kept very clean and tidy. Breakfast is a large buffett with the usual amenities and was very good. In the morning we took a walk on 44th St and found a large Asian Cultural Center about two blocks away. It has a lovely garden area with ponds that you can walk through and has several restaurants with Asian menus. If you want a real treat, walk through the grocery store and see items not normally found in your garden variety grocery store! Fresh fish,in tanks and on ice, unusual meats and veggies are just a few. I love talapia and this is the first time I actually saw the real thing swimming in a tank! It is very interesting and I learned a lot! Being close to the airport, I was concerned about noise, but although you could faintly hear some of the jets, it was by no means noisy. It was very quiet and the cozy beds made it easy to get a good night sleep. If I return to this area, I will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: traveler45876
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel from check-in to departure. Very aesthetic, extremely comfortable well designed rooms (suites), excellent buffet breakfast, friendly helpful staff, very central location in Phoenix. Would return here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Surprise(s)”
Reviews.Author: taprennoc
Reviews.Content: I am normally not a fan of outdoor access hotels, meaning the doors to the rooms open up to the outside as opposed to being in a "tower" with all the rooms off a hallway.. so when I saw this was an outdoor access hotel I was a bit nervous. But access to the rooms is only available thru the lobby area or the secured gates around the pool. So it wasn't like a motel open to parking lot or anybody on the street. It felt safe, and then when I saw the room, WOW! I have stayed at several doubletree as well as other hilton family hotels over the last several years, and I have to say, this was one of the nicest "suite" hotels I have stayed in. The room was large, spacious, and furnished with real furniture, not that cheap thin motel furniture you find in so many hotels. The living room also had what appeared a new large flat screen tv. the bedroom had the infamous doubletree bedding (one of the most comfy in the industry) and the small kitchenette would be nice if there for more than one night like myself. I found 2 full size bottles of complimentery water (surprise) which were nice to wash down the warm chocolate chip cookie given at check in. The room was clean, the furniture was in good shape and comfortable. The bathroom was bright, updated, and nice touches like a real bathroom rug (another nice surprise) as opposed to a towel on the floor. Nice shampoos, soaps, and lotions. Also went to the gym which was large, nice, and well equipped. It had a flat screen tv hanging in the corner of the room, but some of the machines also had the individual tv screens and they even provided headphones for personal use in the gym area (yet another nice surprise.) I believe I paid 94.00 for a Saturday Night. I wish I had brought my bathing suit as the pool area looked nice as well and the courtyard was welcoming with cool lights hanging from the trees. 94.00 was a real bargain for this nice of a hotel and room. I really hope next time I am in Phoenix I can stay here again. Oh, and it was about a 7 minute drive to the airport, so great location for those early morning flights.

Reviews.Title: “Great for being stuck in Phoenix!”
Reviews.Author: brendasue513
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our "distressed passenger" overnight stay in Phoenix. The room was beautiful, and the bule chees burger in the resturant was WONDERFUL! I'm so glad we got stuck there. The airline guy tried to get us to go somewhere else, I think he got kick backs, but the DT had free transportation to a from the airport, spacious, nice and clean rooms and an excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Cookies is a warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: WugMother
Reviews.Content: We booked via the Doubletree's website. They have a wonderful web only deal of $69 which was fantastic compared to other hotels that also provide breakfast. Other pluses: shuttle from airport, large buffet breakfast with real fresh fruit, eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, cereals, lots of healthy choices. A bit wierd about the breakfast--the host makes you wait for a free table and it was really busy the morning we were there, about 8 am on Dec 26. Lots of people were waiting and the wait did move. The host takes your name. Also, unlike other hotel buffets, a server takes your drink order (and expects a tip via a little form they give you.) The place has an old school feel with its outdoor hallway but this allows the rooms to be very deep/big. Our room had 2 queen beds, and a suite area with a kitchenette (micro, small fridge, coffee maker) and hide-a-bed. 2 TV's! Nice extras in the room like Wolfgang Puck coffees, nice teas and Nutragena toiletries including sunscreen. Windows in the room open to fresh air. Yeah! The rooms have nice updates like the furniture but could use a new bathtub--ours was shallow and old but not gross or anything. Everything was spotless. Big negative: no free internet in the room. The marketing materials say there's internet in the public places but it didn't work for us in the restaurant. We didn't try other spots. It's $10 a day or something. Other hotels seem to include it as a standard these days. The airport shuttle was super easy. We called the hotel upon arrival at the free hotel phones near the luggage pick up. The hotel operator was friendly and efficient -- asking us which terminal and telling us which door to exit (there are many) and said the bus would be there in about 10 minutes, and it was. Downside--the bus will not take you to the car rental building. Everyone on the hotel shuttle needed to get to their car rental the next day and the shuttle driver was polite but said he could not take us there as it wasn't on his route. The car rental centre is away from the airport. Oh well. He dropped us at the airport and we took the airport's shuttle to the car rental centre. We did not explore outside of the hotel. It was xmas eve and everything was closed, except thankfully the restaurant at the hotel. We had an excellent meal of fish, salads, kids had kids meals. All reasonably priced. It's in a hotel zoned area, didn't seem like there were nice places to walk or anything, but it's certainly close to the airport! The fitness room was well equipped with a TV at every bike, and had more decent equipment than most hotels. The pool looked nice but we didn't go in--it wasn't lit up or anything and there was a huge puddle that we'd have to walk thru in order to approach poolside. Maybe it had rained that day. There are nice outdoor sitting areas, with palm trees. Pretty. Overall, this was excellent value for the very large room and hefty breakfast you get. Staff were extremely pleasant and friendly. No hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: beatricepugzilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel twice in the last 2 weeks. First time, absolutely wonderful - Hilton Honor Diamond reward in room, awesome fitness center and the staff could not be any nicer. Second stay, no Hilton Honor reward given in room and the fitness room was a mess - told the front desk that it needed to be tended to - the second day, the room was even more of a mess - oh well... The fitness center, even with the mess, is 100% better than most of the fitness rooms in other hotels. Would definately stay here again - travel each week for business and if all that is wrong is as described above - and all for $99 bucks a night - then count me in.

Reviews.Title: “clean airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelgirl72
Reviews.Content: A welcome and pleasant surprise after the foul hotel accomodations at Grand Canyon. Front desk check in was most pleasant and the children were given some delicious large warm chocolate chip cookies. Business area allowed me to use computer/internet/printer to quickly and conveniently print boarding passes. Very large clean 2 room suite with nice ammenities: neutrogena soaps, comfortable beds, very good towels and bed linens, two televisions, microwave, wolfgang puck coffee/tea, refrigerator, wireless internet. This hotel is older, so we had some patchwork on the ceilings and the couch appeared somewhat worn. Pool was very relaxing. Did not need map to the airport, street signs led us straight there. Missed breakfast, we were too early. I would stay here again and will look for doubletree in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: GoldilocksArizona
Reviews.Content: We needed a room close to the airport, to catch an early morning flight. Check in was quick, and they handed each of us a warm chocolate chip cookie. That was nice, but then we saw our room and it was spacious and inviting. The sheets smelled wonderful, faintly of citrus. The next morning we were up early and checked out when the desk clerk asked if we needed their shuttle to the airport. We said no thanks, we needed to park our car at the terminal. She then told us we could leave our vehicle in the hotel lot for a few days AT NO CHARGE. Wow! So, we lingered over another cup of coffee and took the shuttle right to our terminal. It was a great way to start our long weekend. By the way, on our return, the shuttle was easy to catch right back to our car. No hassles. We didn't have a chance to check out the pool or other amenities, but you can be sure we'll be back again soon. This hotel knows the definition of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Older”
Reviews.Author: heumanntouch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the heart of Phoenix and is just a stones throw from the Phoenix Airport, even though you are that close you do not hear that planes at all. The property is a good value but is dated somewhat, and the room we stayed in had a musky smoke oder to it, as though the room had been a smoking room at some point in the past. The free breakfast was alright, but if there is a long line, I would skip it. The staff was very helpful, and even let me check in before 12 noon, and gave me a choice of rooms on the property. If you are not into kids stay away from the rooms that are near the pool as it gets loud. There are several restaurants located close by just north on 44th St. (Moes, IHop, Grill Next Door (burger joint), Slotsky's Deli, etc)

Reviews.Title: “Dependable offering - close to airport - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Suite2100
Reviews.Content: I travel to Phoenix for business about once a quarter for business and have stayed at this property twice now. Both times I have found that: -- The room was clean, and the photos on Travelocity etc are a true representation of what you get -- Rooms are a "suite" that I expect from Doubletree including separate sleeping area and microwave and small fridge -- The front desk staff is above average especially for an airport location -- The breakfast buffet was free and not very crowded (I only stay mid-week when families etc are not around like weekends) -- Parking was available and free The complaints on noise likely come from this location having open common courtyards - not a closed "box" design. I have really not had an issue though with noise. In my view this property is a safe bet for Phoenix airport stays - and I will use it again in the future for my business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Doubletree”
Reviews.Author: GoChargers85
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Doubletree for 2 nights. We were in town for an ASU graduation. We arrived at the airport and used the courtesy phone in baggage claim to call the hotel. The shuttle arrived in less than 10 minutes. Check-in was quick and simple and the whole family loved the warm chocolate chip cookies. Our room/suite was terrific. A very spacious living area with a fold out sofa bed. It also had an in-room safe, microwave, fridge, coffeemaker and 46" flat panel TV. The bedroom was roomy and had its own TV. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. We ordered room service one night and they were quick and friendly. The room rate included a breakfast buffet. It was the standard large chain included buffet. The staff were always friendly and even provided a complimentary tube of toothpaste after ours was comfascated by TSA. The hotel is in a business park close to the airport, so there are not a lot of ammenities closeby, although this was not an issue for our short trip. Noise was not an issue. After video check out I requested the shuttle to get back to the airport and the driver was outside in less than 2 minute. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, convenient, friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Doctor_Jesse
Reviews.Content: My company has an arrangement with this hotel, and I have stayed several times over the past ten years. I have always found the hotel's personnel to be friendly and helpful, and this stay was no exception. The hotel characteristic that I most appreciated was the very large room (suite) - much larger than the Hilton I stayed at in San Francisco the following week (which was much more expensive). I'm not sure if all the suites at this hotel are equally large; however, if not, ask for a room on the 5th floor. As stated by others, the hotel is quite close to Sky Harbor Airport, but I did not hear planes at all during the stay. The hotel has a nice restaurant - I had only breakfast and a few evening takeaways - and the food was quite good. Internet access was $10 per day, but it was free to me because my company had paid a business rate. There is also a running path along the Salt River Canal about half a mile East of the hotel. Convenient if you don't want to be cooped up on a treadmill or don't want to run along the streets. Phoenix has a surfeit of gorgeous hotels, and this Doubletree can't be counted among them. Nonetheless, it fits the bill in several ways for people who have things to do during the day and want a comfortable, friendly, and spacious place to use as home base.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overnight!”
Reviews.Author: canela42
Reviews.Content: Close to the airport, nice accommodations. Of course, the kids loved the cookies, lemonade and the pool! The staff were wonderful and offered to drive us downtown to "restaurant row" in town. We took them up on it and we were very glad we did. We had a nice meal in town and the kids got a little exercise as well. Neat note: This hotel is just a short walk away from the Pheonix Chinese Cultural Center, a really neat place if you feel like exploring!

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal- Near Highways and Airport but Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Royzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights over a rainy Phoenix weekend. I'd advise anyone wanting to check this hotel out to read the very fair, accurate and detailed Tripadvisor review posted on 6/24/07 by Gr8ful321 from Las Vegas. I'll add a few things: - Hotel is located near the airport and between two major highways; but very quiet for such a location. Easy off & on access. - Very comfortable beds. - Clean rooms but not a "brand new" feel. - One nice thing about this hotel is that you can (tilt-in) open the Bedroom window and get some fresh air. - I never had to wait more than 3 minutes for someone to seat me and offer me coffee and ( good) juice at the complimentary buffet breakfast. - Pool was heated and pretty clean; decent hot-tub. - Gym was small but had several treadmills ; one cross trainer, one bike, weight machine and free weights. Mini-TV's and headphones provided. - Nice little mini-radio with two small speakers in the living room that will play your iPod if you have a cord. - I would suggest checking out the Asian ("Ranch") supermarket which is within walking distance. Very wide selction of unusual Asian and Mexican foods. - I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ou_chot
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very noisy. Could hear the cleaning crew throughout the hotel. Patrons walking around on walkways and stairs were very noisy. Expect 30 minute wait for the free breakfast buffet (eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, cereal, fruit, & muffins). Front desk was not helpful in advice for dinner. Tried to recommend a restaurant they had never been to. Bathroom had a leak in the ceiling. Good location, nice courtyard area, free business center, & heated pool.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Clean home base for a Phoenix visit”
Reviews.Author: PeaceableKingdom
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for Thanksgiving and the weekend following and found the location to be excellent for getting around town. Close to the airport but far enough away for total relaxing quiet at the pool. The hotel is spotlessly clean and as comfortable as home. The staff were uniformly friendly and it is obvious that they take pride in their workplace. The lobby has a small section filled with awards they have won from Hilton. The complimentary hot breakfast was a nice touch . . . and quite popular as the restaurant was filled each day I was there. Parking is convenient to your room - you don't have to go through the lobby to get to your room from the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilites, Friendly staff = pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: Lee S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Doubletree for 4 nights in mid-October as part of a tour group. The hotel is located close to Sky Harbor International Airport, but you really wouldn't know that if you came by car. The hotel offers a shuttle service to the airport every 30 minutes, and also shuttles to other locations. It is located in a business park, which makes having transportation a must if you venture off the grounds--and who doesn't? I did see the Chinese Cultural Center (a five minute walk) had a few Asian restaurants plus a Quiznos. Belvedere's in the Doubletree is another option, but other than that you'll need wheels. My room was great, and not as tight as some "suite" hotels I've stayed at. Kitchenette area adequate as was bath. Living area had tv and room safe as well as sofa. Bedroom stocked with another tv, desk, armoire,bed, and plenty of pillows. Wolfgang Puck coffee provided while bath included Neutragena products. No notable views from the room, so you can keep the curtains closed. My only disappointment with the room was that the tv remote lacked a sleep feature. I made use of the pool, fitness center, and business center, all of which require your room key for entry. I always appreciate the free internet provided by Doubletree on the computers there. The staff made a point of greeting you at each encounter. And apparently someone has the duty to make sure the Doubletree logo is imprinted into the sand of each ashtray/trash container on site. The complimentary breakfast buffet was very nice, particularly the fresh fruit, muffins, eggs, and sausage. I was a bit annoyed that upon being seated the staff only offered to serve me juice or coffee, while advising me where I could get my own water. That was definitely a first--and it happened twice with different wait staff. I didn't try the lunch or dinner at Belvedere's, but a friend tried the salmon and loved it. Now I know I'm nit-picking, but the warm chocolate chip cookie I craved and have enjoyed at other Doubletrees was missing in Phoenix. The one I got was cold and rather bland. Other DoubleTrees I've stayed have them prominently displayed for guests to pick up on the way in or out as a snack, but not here. But then again I would have passed on another like I had. Otherwise, a fine stay!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: imontheroadagain
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this property and we again were not disappointed. We found the staff to be nice and generally helpful. The breakfast buffet is very good with lots of fresh fruit and hot food. The only complaint is that the pool area needs washed down and I had to call for more towels on two occasions. Otherwise, I think this property is a good find for almost anyone staying in the airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: RockyMtnGoat
Reviews.Content: What a welcome respite from the searing Phoenix heat and the terrible Millenium McCormick Ranch. Friendly and easy check in, a large suite with a very comfy king bed, warm cookies, helpful staff, and close to the airport without the airport noise. We were bumped from our flight and ended up staying an unplanned extra night, and we were given the same $99/night rate which was a nice touch. We'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: honved
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Doubletree Gateway Center en route from Phoenix airport to upstate Arizona. Arriving early evening, the welcome that we received was excellent with free lemonade and warm cookies. We were given very clear directions to our suite which was ideal for what we needed. The layout of the suites is fine although the living room is a bit smaller than many. The bedroom was very well decorated and of a high standard for accomodation in this price range. Breakfast is included in the price, which with a party of four makes the whole package very good value. We thought this was an ideal introduction to our holiday and would recommend this hotel to anyone on a budget just looking to get their head down before moving on.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel caters to business travelers or couples”
Reviews.Author: VegasBling
Reviews.Content: The following is a very detailed review of the Doubletree Guest Suites Gateway-Phoenix Center for those that like to know as much as they can about a hotel they are considering. I travel frequently as a business traveler and with my family. My review will be through the eyes of both. However, the gist of my review is this: the Doubletree definitely caters to solo travelers or couples . . . once a third or fourth guest is introduced, I do believe what the hotel has to offer may be more or less desirable depending on the needs of the family/group. At the time of my writing, this hotel is listed as #9 most popular in Phoenix out of 153 hotels. I do believe that favorable reviews are mostly from business writers or those not needing a room with two beds (I will expound on this subject later). The Doubletree is one of the closest hotels to the Phoenix Sky Harbor Airport. A business traveler would definitely need a vehicle if needing to travel to nearby stores, restaurants or other parts of town. However, the Asian Cultural Center is within 5 minutes walking distance which includes Quizno’s, a Ranch Market, an inexpensive Asian Seafood Buffet, and Golden Buddha Restaurant. The hotel is conveniently located off of the 202 Loop which can reach I-10 and other freeways easily. Doubletree Suites is located in a beautiful business park with ample, mature landscaping. Parking surrounds the property on both sides and the back, and the wrought iron security gates must be opened with a room key. There is onsite security that patrols inside and outside the hotel. In addition, there is business park security that patrols neighboring businesses such as UnitedHealth Group and its parking garage. If traveling south on North 44th Street (opposite direction of airport), the following places can be found within five minutes drive time: Target, Costco, Applebee’s, IHOP, Ross, Fry’s Groceries, Del Taco, Sears, The UPS Store, McDonald’s. At 44th and Indian School Road, there is an Einstein Bagels, Pei Wei, Rubio’s Mexican Food, Subway, and a Starbuck’s. There was a previous posted review on Trip Advisor that the hotel is in a “bad” neighborhood. If traveling east on Van Buren, after 15 minutes, a traveler will end up in downtown Tempe where there are charming shops and many places to eat. However, if traveling west on Van Buren, a motorist will find an economically challenged area. My family and I were assigned Room #556. I was traveling with my husband and father-in-law. We were in town attending a family oriented convention. When booking through the hotel’s reservations, I was informed that the hotel only has 20 rooms with two beds in it – the majority of the rooms had one King Bed and a sofa sleeper (out of 242 rooms). The hotel was sold out the entire time I was there. There was a light stale smell upon entering the room. I slept on the King Bed and found it to be very comfortable. The sheets are of high quality thread count, and there are ample pillows on the pillow and in the armoire. I also slept on the sofa bed – it was uncomfortable and a typical night on a sofa bed – my hip bone was on the middle bar of the sofa bed the entire night, and the mattress was thin. Hotel staff called it a Queen Sofa Sleeper, but it is a double bed sleeper. Though children would probably be comfortable on the sofa sleeper, I do not recommend it for adults. Front desk staff and in-house reservations advised us that a room with two beds is on a first come, first serve basis, and is not guaranteed. Being on a comfortable bed is very important and I felt that a lack of comfortable sleeping areas for everyone in my party was a disappointment. However, for those who are looking for value based lodging, they may be willing to exchange comfort for other amenities. Wireless High Speed Internet Access is available in the room through LodgeNet for $9.99 (24 hour standard access), $11.99 (24 hour Real IP Access), and $39.99 for 5 day Standard Internet. Users with Pre-Paid Access Code through LodgeNet may access the Internet with their prepaid code. However, Hilton HHonors Gold or Diamond members get free Internet access. The code for the Internet changes daily and wireless Internet is charged from 12 p.m. to 12 p.m. the next day. There is a 24 Hour Business Center located near the Concierge’s Desk. Hotel guests may access this area with a room key. Guests may use the computers short term to print airline boarding passes or send faxes. There three computers – two at a desk and one for guests that stand to use the computer. There is one fax machine and two printers. The hotel rooms face outdoor walkways. There are three sections which rooms are located: 1) courtyard, 2) Pool and Spa Area, and Pavilion Areas with six stories. I noted that in the afternoon, the western sun hits the areas labeled as 08-21 and 48-58. However, the air conditioning in room works well. The Courtyard area appears to be the quietest and easiest to access. The Pool and Spa area can be “loud” when there are people swimming when passing by, though you can faintly hear the loud talking/kids screaming if your television is low. The Pavilion area is an outside permanent tent with mini white tree lights underneath along with ceiling fans. Strangely, at night, there were many maid cleaning carts “parked” near this area. If you are bringing your own bags to the room, it can be a pain in the neck as it can be a distance in walking and trying to use your room keep to keep opening the security gates. However, one can obtain a luggage cart from the Concierge’s Desk. The Fitness Center was temporarily relocated from Room #125 to Room #123 because Room #125 was in the process of being upgraded (at time of writing, June, 2007). The temporary fitness center had a treadmill, an elliptical machine, an ab station, free weights, and other equipment enough to do a nice work out. Staff is very accommodating, efficient, and helpful. During the time of our visit, the hotel was sold out. I had inquired about a rollaway bed. The “Care Line” is the central place that routes your calls to the appropriate area. My call was forwarded to the Front Desk, and staff there advised me that normally they do have rollaway beds for rent but did not have any due to the high demand. We requested extra towels and an extra blanket and staff arrived both times within minutes. The room itself is spacious with very beautiful, quality pecan wood furniture. The walls between rooms are solid, and we could not hear conversations or other televisions from guests on either side of use. The room has a nice sized refrigerator, coffee maker, modern microwave, two televisions, two telephones, two desk areas, an iron, and a hair dryer. The bedroom has its own door. The “living room” area has the bathroom in its area. This allows for privacy for anyone sleeping in the bedroom in the event there is someone sleeping on the sofa bed in the living room and has to go to the bathroom. Also, even if the television is loud in the living room area, it can barely be heard in the bedroom area, and vice versa. With regard to the bathroom itself, there is no exhaust fan. Even though the walls between hotel rooms appeared to be solid, you could clearly hear others using the bathroom in your own room. The lack of bathroom privacy is the second minus other than the uncomfortable sofa sleeper for guests requiring a second bed. Water pressure is low in the shower and when using the toilet. The toilet also appears to be lower than average. You can also hear water sounds (flushing, toilet use) from other rooms either above or below. I believe that a second towel rack could be useful behind the door and I stated my suggestion on a comment card. There are quality Neutrogena products available. The bottom of the bathtub (permanent non-slip portion) looked unsightly. We were provided a non-slip bath mat. However, the bottom looked either unscrubbed or looked over scrubbed. The television in the bedroom area was snowy with very low volume. We called Building Maintenance who arrived promptly and was exceedingly helpful. Our bathroom sink was draining very slowly, but we did not lodge a request for repair. The room curtains had one set of sheers and one set of black out curtains. The room can be made very dark for sleeping when the light needs to be blocked. Even though the hotel is close to the airport, there was no airplane noise during the day. Interestingly, only after 11 p.m., I could hear airplanes taking off. No one else in my party heard the airplanes after 11 p.m. The full breakfast buffet is complimentary and is a wonderful morning treat served at the onsite restaurant, Belvedere. When you arrive, the hostess will ask you your room number and provide you with a piece of paper that enables guests to place the gratuity on their hotel tab. The buffet includes a fresh fruit mix, cottage cheese, yogurt, prunes, varying baked goods, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, bacon, fried potatoes, link sausage, cold cereal and milk, coffee, orange juice, and apple juice. Though there have been a few negative postings regarding the buffet, I think that it is wonderful for being complimentary and not made to order. There is a wide enough variety for everyone. In closing, solo business travelers will enjoy their stay. Families securing a room at a discounted rate will enjoy the amenities for the price/value. However, families that require a guaranteed second bed and enjoy bathroom privacy may wish to book elsewhere.

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree Suites by Hilton Phoenix
HotelInfo.Address: 320 North 44th Street, Phoenix, AZ 85008
